Description: Fragment from lip of Attic black-glazed pottery cup; concave lip (top lost), incurve below the rim inside; fine black glaze inside and out.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in: D. G. Hogarth, H. L. Lorimer & C. C. Edgar, Naukratis 1903, Journal of Hellenic Studies, vol. 25 (1905), p. 116, fig. 2, no. 2. Höckmann & Möller 2006 no. 27.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 706, no. 645)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1646)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
